Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 (either Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump) and (2) there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met:
1. One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.
2. By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.

P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if either of the following occurs: (a) One of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. (b) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible, with the critical value to look for being 1.8 ˚C.

Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, and if none of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

Q.title: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
This question will resolves as No otherwise.
In the context of this question, an armed conflict will be defined as a dispute that concerns a government and/or territory where the use of armed force between two parties, of which at least one is the government of a state, results in an exchange of weapon fire or detonations

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following are true:

These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
This question will resolve as No otherwise.

P.title: If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected but the upper tax bracket is not increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No.
If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous

P.title: If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected but the upper tax bracket is not increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No.
If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous

not_P.title: If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket not be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected and the upper tax bracket is increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No.
If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden win the presidency of the United States in 2020, will the top tax rate be reinstated to its previous level of 39.6% or more prior to 2025?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will be considered Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the highest tax rate for single taxpayers in the US is raised to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected but the highest tax rate is not raised to at least 39.6%, this question will be marked as No.
If Biden does not win the presidency in 2020, this question will be classified as Ambiguous.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden is elected president of the US for the 2021-2024 term and the highest tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025; (2) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025; (2) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. If either (1) or (2) is not met, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, the resolution for condition (1) will be Ambiguous.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025? (b) Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following is true: (1) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025; or (2) by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. If neither condition is met, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, the first part of the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100 and (b) if Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket not be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (1) by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, and (2) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as No.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, the highest tax bracket will be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025? (b) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following is true: (1) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025; or (2) by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. If neither condition is satisfied, this question will resolve as No.

Q_given_P.title: Given Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If that is the case, then will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100? 

Resolution criteria: 
1. This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. 
2. This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 

If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020 and the highest tax bracket is restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025, and (b) there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025, and (2) by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, the first condition is not satisfied, and this question will resolve as No.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket not be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. para_P.title: Should Joe Biden win the presidency in the US for the 2020 election, will the top tax rate remain below its previous level of 39.6% or greater prior to 2025?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will be answered with Yes if Joe Biden secures the presidency for the 2021-2024 term, and the highest tax rate for single taxpayers in the US is not raised to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected and the highest tax rate is raised to 39.6% or more, this question will be answered with No.
If Biden does not win the presidency in 2020, this question will be considered Ambiguous.

Q.title: Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020 and the highest tax bracket is not restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025, and (2) there is a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following are true: (1) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025; and (2) before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if either of these conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, the highest tax bracket not be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025? (b) Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following conditions is met: (1) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025; or (2) before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if neither of these conditions occur.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025, and (b) if Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths, and (2) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. The question will resolve as No if either of these conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, the highest tax bracket not be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025? (b) Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following conditions is met: (1) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025; or (2) before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. This question will resolve as No if neither of these conditions is met.

Q_given_P.title: Given that Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q_given_P.body: If Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, this question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur. Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if Biden is elected president and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020 and the highest tax bracket not be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025, and (b) there will be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025, and (2) before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. If either or both of these conditions are not met, this question will resolve as No.

P.title: Will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050

para_P.title: By the year 2050, will the cost of water on the NQH20 reach $2,500 (in 2021 USD) per acre-foot?
para_P.body:
Criteria for Resolution
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the water price reaches $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. It will be deemed negative if the water price does not reach $2500 by that specified date, and it will be classified as ambiguous if the NQH20 or a comparable exchange fails to consistently monitor California water prices through to 2050.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The price of water on the NQH20 hits $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050 (2) There is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?

Resolution Criteria

This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050. (2) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. This will resolve positively if this condition is met, negatively if it is not met, and the data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The price of water on the NQH20 does not hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050; (2) There is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The price of water does not hit $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. (2) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. The price of water question resolves negatively if the price hits $2500 by that date, and the global warming question resolves positively if the temperature criterion is met. If either of these conditions fails, the overall resolution will be negative.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The price of water on the NQH20 does not hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050? (b) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?

This question resolves negatively only if both (a) and (b) do not occur.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The price of water on the NQH20 will not hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050? (2) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?

(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.) It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway. The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data.
